publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-614# Dr Elaine Murray: Cashpoint Services—That the Parliament congratulates the Bank of Scotland and the Royal Bank of Scotland for their stance in refusing to charge customers of other banks who use their cashpoint services and urges them to continue with this policy in the interests of low income and rural communities.
S1M-614# Cashpoint Services (lodged on 1 March 2000) Richard Lochhead*

S1M-614# Dr Elaine Murray: Cashpoint Services—That the Parliament congratulates the Bank of Scotland and the Royal Bank of Scotland for their stance in refusing to charge customers of other banks who use their cashpoint services and urges them to continue with this policy in the interests of low income and rural communities. Supported by: Richard Lochhead, Fiona Hyslop*, Shona Robison*
S1M-614# Cashpoint Services (lodged on 1 March 2000) Christine Grahame*, Linda Fabiani*, Andrew Wilson*, Rhoda Grant*
S1M-614# Cashpoint Services (lodged on 1 March 2000) Robin Harper*, Dorothy-Grace Elder*
S1M-614# Cashpoint Services (lodged on 1 March 2000) Irene McGugan*
S1M-614# Cashpoint Services (lodged on 1 March 2000) Cathy Peattie*, Mr Duncan Hamilton*

S1M-614# Dr Elaine Murray: Cashpoint Services—That the Parliament congratulates the Bank of Scotland and the Royal Bank of Scotland for their stance in refusing to charge customers of other banks who use their cashpoint services and urges them to continue with this policy in the interests of low income and rural communities. Supported by: Richard Lochhead, Fiona Hyslop, Shona Robison, Christine Grahame, Linda Fabiani, Andrew Wilson, Rhoda Grant, Robin Harper, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Irene McGugan, Cathy Peattie, Mr Duncan Hamilton, Alex Neil*, Donald Gorrie*
S1M-614# Cashpoint Services (lodged on 1 March 2000) David Mundell*
